movies.title: Manon of the Spring
movies.plot: In this, the sequel to Jean de Florette, Manon (Beart) has grown into a beautiful young shepherdess living in the idyllic Provencal countryside. She determines to take revenge upon the men responsible for the death of her father in the first film.
movies.simplePlot: A beautiful but shy shepherdess plots vengeance on the men whose greedy conspiracy to acquire her father's land caused his death years earlier.

biography.bio: Yves Montand was born on October 13, 1921 in Monsummano Terme, Tuscany, Italy as Ivo Livi. He was an actor, known for The Wages of Fear (1953), Jean de Florette (1986) and Z (1969). He was married to Simone Signoret. He died on November 9, 1991 in Senlis, Oise, France.
biography.name: Yves Montand

biography.bio: Daniel Auteuil was born on January 24, 1950 in Algiers, Alger, France. He is an actor and director, known for Caché (2005), 36th Precinct (2004) and Un Coeur en Hiver (1992). He has been married to Aude Ambroggi since July 22, 2006. They have one child. He was previously married to Emmanuelle Béart and Anne Jousset.
biography.name: Daniel Auteuil

biography.bio: Emmanuelle Béart was born August 14, 1963, in Gassin, France. She lived with her mother, brothers, and sister on a farm not far from Saint-Tropez in Provence (southern France), because her father, singer and poet Guy Béart, did not want his children to be affected by the glamour world of Paris. When Emmanuelle was thirteen, she saw Romy Schneider in the movie Mado (1976). From that time on, she wanted to be an actress. In Emmanuelle's teens, her parents sent her to Montreal, Quebec, Canada, for four years, so she could learn English. There, she was engaged for a Robert Altman movie that was never made. After returning to France, she took drama classes and got her first TV role, in Raison perdue (1984). David Hamilton, the photographer/director, was impressed by her beauty and gave her a role in Premiers désirs (1983). She met her spouse-to-be, Daniel Auteuil, while making L'amour en douce (1985). The film that made her famous in France was Manon of the Spring (1986), in which she played the role of a blonde shepherd dancing nude in the fields. Director Tom McLoughlin chose her out of 5,000 candidates for her first Hollywood picture, Date with an Angel (1987). Emmanuelle is a very sensitive and a perfectionist. For the part of Camille in the film Un Coeur en Hiver (1992), she took violin lessons for a whole year. Her biggest success was as a nude model in the art film La belle noiseuse (1991), which starred Michel Piccoli and was directed by Jacques Rivette.
biography.name: Emmanuelle Béart

biography.bio: Hippolyte Girardot was born on October 10, 1955 in Boulogne-Billancourt, Hauts-de-Seine, France as Frédéric Girardot. He is an actor and director, known for Manon of the Spring (1986), Lady Chatterley (2006) and Paris, je t'aime (2006).
biography.name: Hippolyte Girardot

biography.bio: Margarita Lozano was born on February 14, 1931 in Tetuan, Spain as Margarita Lozano Jiménez. She is an actress, known for A Fistful of Dollars (1964), Jean de Florette (1986) and The Night of the Shooting Stars (1982).
biography.name: Margarita Lozano

biography.bio: Yvonne Gamy was born on June 10, 1904 in Marseille, France as Yvonne Gamerre. She was an actress, known for Manon of the Spring (1986), The Horseman on the Roof (1995) and Terre classée (1985). She died on February 10, 1997 in France.
biography.name: Yvonne Gamy

biography.bio: Ticky Holgado was born on June 24, 1944 in Toulouse, Haute-Garonne, France as Joseph Holgado. He was an actor, known for Amélie (2001), Delicatessen (1991) and A Very Long Engagement (2004). He was married to Edith Holgado. He died on January 22, 2004 in Paris, France.
biography.name: Ticky Holgado

biography.bio: Jean Bouchaud was born on August 3, 1936 in Marseille, Bouches-du-Rhône, France. He is an actor and writer, known for Manon of the Spring (1986), Le train (1964) and Inspecteur la Bavure (1980).
biography.name: Jean Bouchaud

biography.bio: Elisabeth Depardieu was born on August 5, 1941 in Paris, France as Elisabeth Dominique Guignot. She is an actress, known for Jean de Florette (1986), Manon of the Spring (1986) and On ne meurt que deux fois (1985). She was previously married to Gérard Depardieu.
biography.name: Elisabeth Depardieu

biography.bio: Gabriel Bacquier was born on May 17, 1924 in Béziers, Hérault, France as Gabriel-Augustin-Raymond-Théodore-Louis Bacquier. He is known for his work on Manon of the Spring (1986), L'amour des trois oranges (1989) and L'escarpolette (1982).
biography.name: Gabriel Bacquier

biography.bio: Armand Meffre was born on March 16, 1929 in Maubec, Vaucluse, France as Armand Marius Meffre. He was an actor and writer, known for Jean de Florette (1986), Manon of the Spring (1986) and La vieille dame indigne (1965). He was married to Pomme Meffre. He died on January 22, 2009 in Auxerre, Yonne, France.
biography.name: Armand Meffre

biography.bio: André Dupon is an actor, known for Jean de Florette (1986), Manon of the Spring (1986) and Éducation anglaise (1983).
biography.name: André Dupon

biography.bio: Pierre Nougaro is an actor, known for Jean de Florette (1986), Manon of the Spring (1986) and Masques (1987).
biography.name: Pierre Nougaro

biography.bio: Jean Maurel is known for his work on Jean de Florette (1986), Manon of the Spring (1986) and My Mother's Castle (1990).
biography.name: Jean Maurel

biography.bio: Roger Souza is an actor, known for L'homme qui voulait savoir (1988), Jean de Florette (1986) and Manon of the Spring (1986).
biography.name: Roger Souza

categories.category: Best Supporting Actress (Meilleure actrice dans un second rôle)

awards.award: Kansas City Film Critics Circle Awards 1987
New York Film Critics Circle Awards 1987
